title: Understanding Correlation Values
text: A correlation coefficient (r) tells us the strength and direction of a linear relationship between two variables. A value close to $$-1$$ indicates a strong negative linear correlation.

title: Examining the Scatter Plots
text: Look at each scatter plot and see how well the points fit a straight line. For a strong negative correlation $$(r=-0.89)$$, the points should form a tight cluster around a line that slopes downward.

title: Focusing on Direction
text: Since $$r$$ is negative, the trend should be downward. The line that best fits the data will decrease from left to right.

title: Strong Correlation Identification
text: For a correlation of $$-0.89$$, the points should be close to a straight line but with some scatter. Think of a pattern that looks almost like an angled line with small gaps.

title: Selecting the Correct Plot
text: Which plot has points that are tightly clustered around a line trending downward?
